III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes
2.) The clients served by the facility are not part of the plaintiff class and therefore
the facility is not required to follow the ISEP.
3.) The facility does not hold a contract with MDHHS/Children Services, so it is not
subject to contract or policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 The Department needs to be notified anytime a staff or youth in the facility
have tested positive for COVID.
 All staff working in the program need to have evaluations completed even if
they are supervised outside the program.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 Problem solve communication issues with all staff.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care or corporal punishment
during this licensing period.
The facility has not been required to submit any corrective action plans this licensing
period.
Chief Administrator Report
The Chief Administrator identified one area of need for the program. The facility will
provide staff with additional trauma training geared toward working with refugees. The
facility had 4 unplanned discharges and they were all AWOLs.
Interviews
One staff and supervisor did not have any concerns. One staff communicated they
are concerned about the lack of communication and how the supervisor treats the
team members which causes further communication issues. It was also discussed
that one of the staff members is culturally insensitive to the youth at times. The youth
all stated they enjoyed being at the house. They wish they could have their cell
phones, but otherwise did not have any concerns.
1

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility continue on their regular license.
